title: Israel launches major operation in West Bank; Palestinian medics say 10 killed
content: Israel’s military and internal security service said the operation was aimed at infrastructure used by militants in the cities of Jenin and Tulkarm.
summary: Israel’s military and internal security service said the operation was aimed at infrastructure used by militants in the cities of Jenin and Tulkarm.

title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
content: Israel estimates some 117 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 70 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.
summary: Israel estimates some 117 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 70 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.

title: Reuters denies Russian claim its slain security adviser was British spy
content: Russia’s Foreign Ministry spokeswoman connected the killing of security adviser Ryan Evans to foreign mercenaries aiding Ukrainian troops.
summary: Russia’s Foreign Ministry spokeswoman connected the killing of security adviser Ryan Evans to foreign mercenaries aiding Ukrainian troops.

title: What to know about ‘sloth fever’ as U.S., Europe warn of imported cases
content: Twenty cases of the Oropouche virus disease were reported in Florida and one in New York. Symptoms include fever and aches, and the virus poses a particular risk to pregnant women.
summary: Twenty cases of the Oropouche virus disease were reported in Florida and one in New York. Symptoms include fever and aches, and the virus poses a particular risk to pregnant women.

title: Man posing as teen YouTube star sentenced for global child sextortion plot
content: Muhammad Zain Ul Abideen Rasheed used Instagram to ensnare 286 sextortion victims in 20 countries, an Australian judge said. Most of his victims were children.
summary: Muhammad Zain Ul Abideen Rasheed used Instagram to ensnare 286 sextortion victims in 20 countries, an Australian judge said. Most of his victims were children.

title: China, U.S. agree to a leader call in top White House aide’s Beijing visit
content: National security adviser Jake Sullivan’s meeting with top Chinese diplomat Wang Yi is aimed at keeping communication channels open amid strained relations.
summary: National security adviser Jake Sullivan’s meeting with top Chinese diplomat Wang Yi is aimed at keeping communication channels open amid strained relations.

title: In photos: Israel says weapons seized, fire exchanged in West Bank operation
content: At least 9 Palestinians have been killed in the operation in Jenin, Tulkarm and al-Fara’a camp near Tubas in the West Bank, Palestinian officials said.
summary: At least 9 Palestinians have been killed in the operation in Jenin, Tulkarm and al-Fara’a camp near Tubas in the West Bank, Palestinian officials said.

title: U.N. says evacuation order in Gaza’s Deir al-Balah ‘upends’ aid efforts
content: A U.N. agency says Israel’s evacuation orders in Gaza’s Deir al-Balah area have displaced humanitarian workers and disrupted aid.
summary: A U.N. agency says Israel’s evacuation orders in Gaza’s Deir al-Balah area have displaced humanitarian workers and disrupted aid.

title: Can Japan’s love for 7-Eleven survive a Canadian takeover?
content: The convenience store chain has become a cornerstone of Japanese life, but a bid to buy the company by the retail giant that owns Circle K has unnerved its fans.
summary: The convenience store chain has become a cornerstone of Japanese life, but a bid to buy the company by the retail giant that owns Circle K has unnerved its fans.

title: A month after Venezuela’s contested election, the opposition fights on
content: The opposition in Venezuela and its supporters have stood courageously, but risk being muffled by the Maduro regime’s suppression.
summary: The opposition in Venezuela and its supporters have stood courageously, but risk being muffled by the Maduro regime’s suppression.

title: Biden approved Gaza pier despite internal pushback, watchdog finds
content: The Gaza pier project faced early concerns within the U.S. government, including a warning that rough seas could pose a challenge, an inspector general found.
summary: The Gaza pier project faced early concerns within the U.S. government, including a warning that rough seas could pose a challenge, an inspector general found.

title: Hostage rescued from Gaza found alone in tunnel, Israeli military says
content: Farhan al-Qadi, 52, spent 326 days in captivity in Gaza before he was discovered by Israeli troops operating in southern Gaza.
summary: Farhan al-Qadi, 52, spent 326 days in captivity in Gaza before he was discovered by Israeli troops operating in southern Gaza.

title: U.S. soldier who entered North Korea will plead guilty to desertion
content: Travis King, an Army private, crossed into North Korea last year and was expelled. He’ll appear at a hearing Sept. 20, his lawyer said.
summary: Travis King, an Army private, crossed into North Korea last year and was expelled. He’ll appear at a hearing Sept. 20, his lawyer said.

title: In first major speech, Keir Starmer paints a gloomy picture of Britain
content: The new U.K. prime minister talked about societal “rot” and financial black holes and said “things will get worse before they get better.”
summary: The new U.K. prime minister talked about societal “rot” and financial black holes and said “things will get worse before they get better.”

title: Ukraine’s Zelensky says incursion into Russia part of plan to end war
content: Ukraine’s top commander reported that more than a 100 settlements in Russia’s Kursk region had been taken, along with 594 prisoners of war.
summary: Ukraine’s top commander reported that more than a 100 settlements in Russia’s Kursk region had been taken, along with 594 prisoners of war.

title: Italy opens investigation into captain in deadly yacht sinking, lawyer says
content: James Cutfield, a veteran sailor from New Zealand, is being investigated after the Bayesian capsized, killing seven, including tech figure Mike Lynch.
summary: James Cutfield, a veteran sailor from New Zealand, is being investigated after the Bayesian capsized, killing seven, including tech figure Mike Lynch.

title: U.S. military’s Tinder ad in Middle East raises eyebrows
content: An advertisement warning that U.S. fighter jets were ready to respond to provocations showed up on a dating app in Lebanon.
summary: An advertisement warning that U.S. fighter jets were ready to respond to provocations showed up on a dating app in Lebanon.

title: American dies in ice cave collapse during Iceland glacier tour
content: One American died and a second was injured after an ice cave popular with tourist groups collapsed Sunday afternoon.
summary: One American died and a second was injured after an ice cave popular with tourist groups collapsed Sunday afternoon.

title: Arrest of Telegram’s Durov inflames debate over online crime and free speech
content: The arrest in France of the site’s Russia-born founder highlights ongoing disputes over social media’s responsibility for spreading child sexual abuse material and other criminal content.
summary: The arrest in France of the site’s Russia-born founder highlights ongoing disputes over social media’s responsibility for spreading child sexual abuse material and other criminal content.

title: Dam collapse in Sudan floods villages; local media reports dozens missing
content: At least four people died after the Arbaat dam’s collapse, according to Sudan’s Health Ministry. Local media, citing government officials, said the toll is probably higher.
summary: At least four people died after the Arbaat dam’s collapse, according to Sudan’s Health Ministry. Local media, citing government officials, said the toll is probably higher.
